text: I have waited in the parking lot for 4 hours for a friends who was a patient to get out. It was incredibly ridiculous. I sat here an hour and a half past closing and watched employees leave. No one answered my calls and no one was inside to help me. This is the most ridiculous experience I have ever had.

name: Haley
text: After having a bad experience at Auburn Urgent Care I decided to come here a few days later, I am so glad I did! The staff was kind, professional, and knowledgeable, the building was very clean, and I wasn't there for more than 15 minutes. I was able to get my TB Skin Test in less than 2 minutes once I was brought to the back, and an added bonus - it didn't hurt at all! The staff's communication skills are unmatched, I will definitely be coming here for all of my work/school medical needs.

name: Marilyn Bradbard
text:
I went for COVID testing today. I went inside and signed up for an appointment time of 2:40 then went to my car to wait for the appointment time. At 2:40 I went inside assuming I would be seen soon. Instead it took more than 2.5 hours to be seen. The waiting room was extremely crowded and no provision was made to allow me to wait in my car and to be called when they were ready. If I didn’t have COVID when I got there, I probably have it now. I probably should have just left but by the time I thought about it I had already invested too much time with the appointment.
It is a ridiculous setup. There should be nobody in the waiting room for longer Han a few minutes. People should be sent to their cars to wait and be called when they are ready to see them. This is a medical facility. They should know better.

resp.text: We would like the chance to turn your experience around. If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at American Family Care - South College(334) 203-6489 to speak to our manager directly.

name: Life As Duke
text: My family and I visited for COVID testing. We signed a clipboard with our name and number beside a time slot and was called in at our time to be tested. We are heading to Hawaii as we speak. Things were smoother than we though. We read reviews before going and was hesitant but we’re so glad we decided to go ahead and try them out. Great experience.. It’s a PANDEMIC people CALM DOWN!!! 3-5 hours is not bad for a WALK IN CLINIC that sees more than just COVID testing.

resp.text: We’re so glad that we were able to go above and beyond your expectations! Thanks again for the recommendation, and have an amazing day!

text: Very disappointed with service. Overcharged for COVID test and getting nowhere when we try and get someone in billing. They are taking advantage of a pandemic, overcharging you, and  making it impossible  to try to get in touch with a human being. Definitely would find somewhere else to go

text: Today was my second time visiting this location for COVID testing. The first time I waited 4 hours to be seen and get my results (for a test I was told that takes 15 minutes), but I chalked it up to me being a first time patient and the holiday rush before Thanksgiving. Today I waited 3 hours to be seen for another COVID test despite getting there 15 minutes after opening with roughly 10 people ahead of me in line. During this time I watched the lobby fill up and empty twice, and watched several people show up, be seen, and leave that were also there for the same test as me. I was not given any explanation when I inquired on the hold up. I was willing to overlook this issue once but never again.

text: Came here twice in one week. The first time I got here at 1pm and signed there sheet for 3:40pm. Came back at 3:40 and it took them until after 6pm to actually see me. So, for my second visit I decided to come before they open and be the first person in the list. I walk in at 8am and they ask me to sign the sheet. I sign for 8:40am and sit down. At 10:40am I went to the front desk and asked how much longer it would be and I was responded with “have you checked in”. Apparently I was supposed to check in at 8:40 but was never told that step. Very disappointed with the lack of communication in this facility in such critical medical times.

Don’t bother coming here if you have anything to do the rest of the day. Even with an appointment, I’ve waited over 2 hours to get out of here.

They never see patients on time. When they do take you back, they often leave you in a room by yourself for 30+ minutes, come in and see you for a few minutes, then leave you again for another 30 minutes.

Best part? They don’t give you the opportunity to leave feedback. It’s ridiculous.

text: This has got to be the fastest urgent care I’ve ever been to. Drew blood (and gave me a Gatorade when I almost passed out) and took a urine test and came back to me within 15 minutes. Everyone is really nice too.

name: EthanG
text: I was told i was going to be contacted about my lab results and 2 days later i go in ( because their phones never work or their too lazy to answer) and am still unable to talk about my lab results with a doctor. I was told the receptionist will read it to me which is completely unprofessional. I wouldnt be upset if it wasnt something very important concerning my health.

name: Charis Hampton
text: After my daughter had a HORRIBLE experience at AFC Tiger Town,  I called this location and explained the situation on how to read my insurance card and when my daughter showed up they treated her AWESOME.

name: Ansleigh Banks
text:
I have never been to a more disorganized clinic in my life.  Only rating it this well because of the wonderful reception staff and physician assistant that I saw on the day of my visit.  The lack of covid-19 precautionary measures is alarming.  The waiting room is packed full of people (many coughing) waiting for covid testing (walk-in appointments). There should be some kind of wait in your car if you're there for covid testing available, entry through another door, make an appointment to be tested, etc, to limit the amount of contact between potentially infected patients and people who are there for things like a sprain or a bite wound. On top of that there was no cleaning of seats in the waiting room going on between patients.
They failed to ask for my pharmacy during the triage process, so when they told me I was ready to go, I asked where to pick up my meds as I noticed a pharmacy in the waiting room.  They told me my meds were ready to go at the pharmacy I was asked for in triage.  When I said there was no pharmacy asked for in triage, they asked me for my pharmacy, which then never sent my meds to.  They conveniently closed a few minutes after I left (I was in the waiting room for 2 hours).  When I called the next morning, I was on hold for 45 minutes constantly having my call transferred to the back staff who would never pick up only to be told they were too busy to deal with sending my call to the back again and that I could come to their pharmacy to get the prescriptions.  Which if they had told me that the night before I would have already had 2 doses of much needed medication.
Basically this place is pure chaos.  I understand that things are hard with covid and healthcare workers are stretched thin, but this clinic is likely creating more cases by their poor planning and crowding of those exposed to covid with uninfected people.  It's a shame that this is the only choice that blue cross blue shield members have for urgent care in Auburn.

name: Julia Jackson
text: If you are a student do not come here on a class day!!! You will wait for an insane amount of time (usually over 3 hours). The staff is rude and definitely not worth the 3 hour wait time.

name: LaDonna Moss
text: My daughter visited this facility on 8/23 so sick and they sent her home with ZERO prescriptions.  I called on Tuesday and spoke with Mia and told her she was still VERY congested and she said they would call her in scripts to the local pharmacy.  They never did!!!  My husband called Mia the next day and asked for the doctor to please call her in something for congestion, she’s very sick and was told they would.  Today is August 31st and still NOTHING!  As a parent many states away from my daughter, I’m so worried for her health!  She will NEVER use this urgent care again!  Don’t waste your time and money at this facility 😡

text: Honestly I wanted to give them one star but the day I visited everyone was so nice. I went in to get tested for Covid 19 on a Friday and knowing I wouldn’t get my results back until the following week. Monday came I called and was told they would call me when my results arrive. Tell me why it’s been 3 weeks now I found out I was positive only because I downloaded the labcorp app earlier this year. They still haven’t called and said anything and Thank God I had labcorp app because I would’ve still been in the dark. Not that they care but I am better now. Someone who’s experiencing something on this level shouldn’t have to go through this. This is very very sad and I pray no one else has to experience this kind of neglect. A virus such as this should not be ignored and if anyone is getting tested please go somewhere that is reliable. I don’t know who was responsible for reaching out with my results but this was a horrible experience! Be blessed

name: Kittichai Kerdsongsang
text: If you just have a headache and fever,  do not come here. You may probably end up paying $470. Thankfully I had an insurance but I still have to pay ~$200. I had a bad experience here. The doctor came to check on me and gave me some Tylenol, but the fever was not going down. They had my blood tested which took more than an hour, but it was negative. so I asked the doctor, there was anything wrong? She said " I don't know!!?? I had to lay down in the room for 2 hours to wait for whatever they were working on. I was so hungry and the headache was getting worse. The doctor came back and gave me more Tylenol. They also gave me 2 injections. Finally they prescribed me the antibiotic pill and some allergy medicine. I don't understand why they gave me so many medications, because I didn't have any allergic. I also had a bad diarrhe when I was taking thoes pills. I used to take an anti biotic pill from Auburn Med clinic but it did not show a bad side effect. Also the doctor an AU med clinic seem more professional. They can identify the symptoms and tell me when I will get better. Unlike this place, charge me ~$120 for office evaluation and told me " I don't know what was wrong!!  They charged so many fee but low performance (took so long). By the way, AU med clinic doesn't charge any lab performance fee if you have an insurance. If they wasn't close that day I would have gone there.

resp.text: It's upsetting to hear that your experience was anything but stellar. We would like to work towards a resolution, so if you are willing, please reach out to us at (334) 758-2020 to discuss this further.

text: Staff were very helpful, courteous and friendly. I was treated like a valued customer, and am pleased with the treatment I received. The doctor was very easygoing, putting me at ease that he knew what he was doing.  He joked a lot, lightening the atmosphere.  This helped as my procedure was painful,  not as painful as it has been in the past at the VA.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review! Our teams strive to deliver an excellent experience, and are glad you found this to be the case during your visit. If you have further needs or questions, please reach out. We can't wait to see you again, have a great day!

name: Hannah Eddins
text: I have visited here several times in the past year, but will NEVER be going back again after my experience today. The service was anything but urgent. I walked in in obvious pain (from what I later found was a scratched cornea) and had the receptionist tell me I would have to wait an hour and a half. There was no one in the waiting room and the parking lot was empty. I made another plea to be seen sooner because of my pain and was met with little reaction, even though I couldn't open my eye and was about to cry. Went down the street to Auburn Urgent Care and was in and out, and went to the pharmacy to pick up my prescription all within an hour's time. Not to mention, there were four people ahead of me there, but I waited maybe 10 minutes. Usually don't write reviews, but don't want someone to actually have an emergency and have the same experience as me.

resp.text: Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (334) 758-2020. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: James Mowery
text: Fast, efficient, and thorough. Not sure why others have complained so much. I have been to the Auburn facility three times and my son has been there five times with me. In all of those instances the longest we waited was about 30 minutes. Most times the wait is less than 15 minutes. I have seen Dr. Powell and Dr. Hooker. Both were very pleasant and caring. Each took the time to explain what I was going through and the reason for the medicine they prescribed. My son sees Dr. Powell and cannot say enough good about her. I have Medicare and my son has Tricare. In each case the insurance process was fast and efficient. The onsite pharmacy has reasonable co-pays and is also fast and efficient. The pharmacist took the time explain what each medicine was for and wrote notes for me to use in establishing the best times to take the medicine. The receptionists, and the medical staff were pleasant, courteous, and through. I have been in hospitals of four continents and seen by doctors on five. This facility gets a 100 out of a 100 in my assessment.

name: Victoria Sims
text: This is by far the worst urgent care on the planet. I have RA and went in with an extremely swollen knee and ankle and could barely walk. Everything was fine until it came time to pay. When I explain to the woman at the front desk that my father handles all my medical bills and he wouldn't be able to pay until the afternoon because he was at work she turned me away saying I couldn't have any care until I paid. Thanks urgent care👍🏼👍🏼 I guess everyone can see that you only care about the money coming in and not your patients.

resp.text: Greetings, I am the patient advocate with American Family Care. I am truly saddened that you are dissatisfied with American Family Care, as we strive for 100% patient satisfaction. In addition, unnecessary scripts and procedures are pushed. I can't speak for all of the doctors here, but the ones I have seen were rude. The only saving grace for this location is the pharmacy in house and the pharmacist there.

name: Ta Williams
text: I waited for nearly two hours to be seen and told repeatedly that there were four people in front of me.  When the doctor came in to see me finally she stated in less than a minute that I had strep and began to exit.  I told her that if I had strep I would prefer to have the antibiotic and steroid shot to be sure it didn't get out of hand.  The doctor didnt seem to know what I was talking about and then said I would still need to take oral antibiotic as well.  Shortly thereafter a nurse came in and brought in stapled sheets and told me to check out at the front desk.  After getting to the pharmacy and seeing the prescription I told the lady at the pharmacy that it gives me an allergic reaction the doctor told her that she wanted me to take the medicine because of the strep!  I've been breaking out and went back to get the doctor to check the reaction but I couldn't be seen unless I paid another $30 copay for a continuation of the prior visit!  The doctor has not called me back with my multiple attempts.  This is very unprofessional and they've lost my business!  Clean or nice facility doesn't make up for crappy service!

Yes, I am heavily modified, but to blame my illness on my jewelry in my nose is very rude. I am a professional body modification artist and am well versed in BBP and how to properly sterilize utensils and jewelry.

Care was adequate, but general experience not good. When you work in this field you shouldn't let your beliefs and outlook change how u treat a client. Especially if the client has training in some of the same areas.

When I got home that weekend I wasn't feeling any better, so I went to the doctor at home. They figured out that I had had pneumonia. So I had pneumonia for a whole week luckily I have a good immune system or I would've been in the hospital. Not going back.
